intro: Consolida pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf sweet peas, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pea-like flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters, making it a compact and ornamental choice for gardens. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in clusters and blooming from late spring to early autumn. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun, and it is often used in rock gardens or as a border plant.
